content.description: Shares the same start of Abracadabra then leads right on sustained knobs and dishes to a seperate anchor. Classic
content.location: West face of Blind Man's Bluff

content.description:
Climb

a winding 50’ foot 5.7 cobblestone and nubbin encrusted face

past 6 bolts to a sloping ledge. Above the ledge is an

optional mid-point lower-off anchor equipped with Mussy hooks

. This is a fun lead in itself for the grade and avoids the harder climbing above if desired.

The crux of the climb is the tricky upper section. Pull some hard to see  thin moves on small pockets and rounded edges at the base of the Arete. A BIG left reach gets you to a Thank god hold and gets one

established on the thin face right of the Arete. (Sustained vertical 25 ft.

headwall. 5.11- 4 Bolts.)
content.protection: 11 Bolts to Top anchor (optional lower off from 5.7 section after passing 6 bolts.)
content.location:
This is the first route encountered when arriving at the Blind Man’s Bliff Area from the direction of Bubble Rock (about 3-5 min from the Fire Rd.) Belay from a flat dirt ledge 10 ft. above the trail (leading to 3 Blind Mice Climbs.) The anchor at the top of the climb is located near the summit of the airy tower. T

his tower can be difficult to access from above (Top Rope) without first locating it and scrambling left around an exposed 4th class sloping ramp.

content.description: Traverse up and right, or take the direct variation
content.location: From Abracadabra, take trail down and west to a separate small crag.

content.description: Adventure route with mantle, face, stemming and chimney moves
content.location: Starts in gully right of Three Blind Mice

content.description: Thin face moves to a ledge, stem a dihedral, finish on pockets
content.location: Up the hill when you first arrive at BMB

content.description: Start straight up, or pull the left wave feature.  Pockets lead to a crux bulge, then mellows with 5.9 moves to the anchor. Fun

Follow the obvious offwidth diagonal crack starting at the base of Calistoga Rodeo. Follow mostly 5.7 moves to the right to meet fourth bolt of Little Dreamer after pulling over the bulge.

As temping as it might be to clip the third bolt of Little Dreamer due to some marginal placements, this has potential to create some unmanageable rope drag.
content.protection:
Trad gear, Quickdraws.

Bottom can be protected with a Camalots 0.5 to 2, however wide gear will likely make for better placements.

content.description: Climb the first 5 bolts of Hobnobs (extend draws to reduce drag), then head right to avoid roof crux. Finish on Hobnobs or Siesta anchors. Cool features and knobs.
Starts below the burnt tree left of Siesta, right of Mary. Go up an easy bolted slab to a short overhanging section, pull onto a cool knobby face to finish at mussys.
Pass 3 bolts through the steeper bottom crux section on some sharp knobs, pulls and pockets. The angle eases off after reaching the 4th bolt.
content.protection:
6 glue in bolts to a two bolt anchor shared with “

Little Dreamer” which is the next route down and to the left.
content.location: Belay from the boulder that separates the 3 blind mice belay ledge and the cave area down to the left as you face in to the crag.

content.description: Clip first 2 bolts of Siesta, using long sling on 2nd bolt, then head up and right on knobs and huecos.
content.location: Siesta and Coming Over are the first routes you encounter when hiking over from Bubble.

content.description: This is the wildly overhanging fin of rock that climbs out of the mouth of the cave up a bouldery tufa-like fin through huecos to a corner and ledge before a couple big moves to the anchor. The rock is sharp so wear your chaps and watch the swing if top roping.
content.location: Stem up and right to the first bolt at the mouth of the cave. Follow eight bolts with black bolt hangers to the top of the cliff.

content.description: Start left of cave, climb up the pilar to a steep lava pocket head wall. Below the roof, head right, then back left to keep it 10d, or go straight up using wild heel hook to pull the 11b roof

Climb pillar to broken chute and ledge. Delicate face moves and optional mantle lead to another ledge. Finish on steep wild knobs with hidden crux pocket

TR Tiny Dancer 10c with directional
content.location: West side of Blind Man's Bluff

content.description: Climb unprotected to a dirty corner/crack. 5.8 stemming, knobs, and pockets lead to a ledge. Pull the 10b crux, or head left for 5.8.
content.location: The obvious dirty corner in 3 blind mice alcove

content.description: 70 ft of moderate pockets leads to 2 bolt anchor with lower offs
content.location: 3 east facing routes in a small alcove

content.description: Tricky bulge leads to knobs, pockets, and an exciting finish
content.location: The center route in the 3 Blind Mice alcove
